bibl.title: Letter from [Lawrence Reed] to Emilie Lawrence Reed and Blossom Reed, [April 17, 1940]

div1.p: [Lawrence Reed] sends a first day of issue stamp to his mother and sister.

div1.head: Letter from [Lawrence Reed] to Emilie Lawrence Reed and Blossom Reed, [April 17, 1940]
div1.p:
I wanted to send you
this note with the first day issue
of the beautiful 5¢ stamp honoring
Father-

Terribly sorry there was a
delay in getting the stamps &
envelopes of to you both-
div1.closer:
Devotedly. Your Son and Bro. Hope to see you both real soon
WASHINGTON,
APR.
17
9:00 AM
1940
D. C.
CONQUEST OF YELLOW FEVER
WALTER REED
CONGRESSIONAL MEDAL
WALTER REED
BACTERIOLOGIST
BORN IN 1851 IN VIRGINIA · EDUCATED IN MEDICINE AT
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA, BELLEVUE HOSPITAL (N.Y.)
AND JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY · HE IS BEST KNOWN
FOR HIS RESEARCH WORK IN HAVANA IN 1898 AND HIS
DISCOVERY OF THE METHOD OF TRANSMISSION OF THE
GERMS OF YELLOW FEVER · HE ALSO DID NOTED WORK
IN ERYSIPELAS AND CHOLERA · · · · HE DIED IN 1902
FIRST DAY OF ISSUE
DR. WALTER REED
UNITED
STATES
POSTAGE
5¢
Mrs Walter and Blossom Reed,
c/o Blossom Inn Collage
Blue Ridge Summit
Franklin County
Penna
WcMd.RR.
